notesStmt.note: Much damaged. Incomplete. Lacunae after folios 6, 14, 33, 43, 51, 54, 56, 66, 72, 74, 75, 79, 82.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Portions of Kitab al-anwar wal-maraqib by Yaʻqūb ibn Isḥāq Qirqisānī.

msItem.title: Kitab al-anwar wal-maraqib כתאב אלאנואר ואלמראקב

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each. Traces of quires signatures preserved on folios 19r, 28r, 75r, 81r. The first leaf of the second half of a quire is marked with the Arabic cipher (e.g. 11r, 20r, 39r).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Arabic script of the 11th to 12th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Abu Yusuf Al-Kirkisani. Sefer Mitsvoth. Sect. V. VI. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Or. 2579

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed (folio [85v]).
